page.title: 05Draycott Resident Ray Salt
page.content: There have been many changes in the village of Draycott since I was born in 1944. The volume of traffic has increased considerably since the days when cattle were driven along the A50 to Blythe Bridge market. More cars have enabled people to take employment further afield, which, for the majority people was limited to farming, Creda Cooker factory and Blythe Colours. Bus services through Draycott were better and more frequent. Demolition of cottages, some thatched, erection of more houses, electricity pylons, widening of roads and the building of the by-pass have changed the landscape. Spare plots of land now built on were used for allotments, circuses, fairs, sports etc. Draycott sports centre which was the old tennis club has now become popular.
